characters: SOUTHWEST CORNER OF 3RD AND AVENUE C
PONGS THE MISSILES BACK INTO SPACE
KAY AND JAY DRIVE INTO THE CITY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanks everywhere filled with strange fish. An eclectic NY crowd eats -- Wall Street guys, hipsters, a Chinese famil two, a couple of NYU professor types who love the "authenticity" of this place. KAY flashes a badge to the OWNER, Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Wu.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: (heavily accented, barely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay, Jay... So happy see you... Mr. Wu get you regular table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast, Wu. We'd like to take a look in the tanks.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: Yes, you see, very fresh. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanks in the back, Wu.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: Oh... so sorry... please no English, you come back later... JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, save the chop socky bullshit for the locals, Wu. We need to see the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: (PERFECT ENGLISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you busting my balls, Jay?

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jay, take a look at this. Wu protests, Jay blows by him. THE KITCHEN KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is what you're passing off as tuna? Reveal a giant tank holding a HUGE ALIEN FISH. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I didn't think there was anything uglier than a catfish. Jay taps on the glass -- the fish SNARLS, making Jay JUMP KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly AND a clear violation of Health ordinance 32, selling UNLICENSED EXTRATERRESTRIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: foodstuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: That's an earth fish. Very traditional from China. You arrest me, that's hate crime. They turn their stares on him.
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it would be. (grabbing Wu's apron) If you were Chinese! Reveal -- from the waist down, Wu has the BODY OF A SLUG.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: C'mon, I got larvae to feed. And earth fish is so expensive. This is the only way I could stay afloat. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Wu. You can serve it to your... out of town guests, but locals get earth fish. REAL earth fish. The kind that doesn't jump out of their stomach and get everyone asking a lot of annoying questions. Like, "Why is my lunch eating Daddy?" You got it? (back to the fish) DAMN, that's ugly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, thanks guys. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wu walks them to a table, seats them.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: (for benefit of customers) Allow me most honorable benefit of get you noodles. (FOR GUYS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back, guys. Wu walks off. Jay CLOCKS the other diners. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about this strike you as weird? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, look -- clean fork.
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at table two over there. They haven't ordered a thing. When's the last time Wu let someone sit at a table without ordering? And table five over there just drank his third cup of duck sauce. Now Kay's radar is up -- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to think of it... Why is Wu getting our noodles... outside? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's about to go down. Wu, at the door, closes the blinds. He catches them looki

dialogues.speaker: MR. WU
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys. Wu leaves, quickly pulling the door behind, him. The guys reach for their weapons. And IT GOES DOWN -- It's a SET-UP, and everyone in the restaurant is in on it The hipsters, the families, the wall street guys -- all d various forms of ALIEN WEAPONS and ATTACK It's like a close-quarters Mafia hit -- everyone pumping truckloads of ordnance at each other. Close hand-to-hand combat. Someone wants Jay and Kay dead and they're not taking any chances. Right ahead of the onslaught, JAY GIVES KAY A HAND SIGNAL He nods, and they dive in opposite directions, SAVING THEMSELVES FROM GETTING HIT. But not for long... An explosive lands between them -- Kay gets BLOWN OUT THE FRONT WINDOW, rolls to a stop in t middle of the DESERTED STREET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouetted at the top of the block -- a biker on a motorcycle. As he pulls into the light -- YAZI
Kay's eyes go wide with recognition. Yaz grins a murderous grin... YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things are worth waiting for. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come get it, you worthless PIECE OF--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yaz guns the engine and BEARS DOWN ON KAY.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE WITH JAY
dialogues.text: Getting the worst of it. A messy battle THROUGH THE KITCHEN. The Giant fish's tank gets shot -- the FISH IS FREE! And goes RIGHT AFTER JAY! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably took that whole catfish thing the wrong way -- The fish SNARLS AFTER HIM -- lunges and BITES! JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was jealous, you know? Because you're so pretty! Jay BATTLES THE FISH-- throwing pots and pans in its mout squirting hot sauce -- working like a lion tamer to keep AT BAY-- JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay! KAY!!! Little help! Little help!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE WITH KAY
dialogues.text: Yaz getting closer. He pulls out a CANNON of a gun, fires into the air. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time you don't have your friends to tell you what happens next. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know what happens next.
Kay draws his EQUALLY BADASS-LOOKING WEAPON -- KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting forty years for another shot at you, scum. Kay takes aim and... CLICK! Empty.

dialogues.speaker: GUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Your weapon is empty! Please recharge! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: GUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Sorry you're having trouble! If you survive this encounter, please call customer service at-- Kay throws the gun at Yaz. Yaz laughs. Gets Kay in his sights. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wanted was justice, Kay. Justice for my brothers. But you had to meddle, didn't you? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They deserved what they got. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you say that to their faces when you see them... Puts the barrel in Kay's face and BOOM!!! Yaz goes up in a GIANT EXPLOSION!! Reveal Jay, just fired the shot. Jay looks like total hell, beaten up, covered with 8 kind slime and alien guts. He stumbles over to Kay, who in contrast looks perfectly pressed. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I was thinking about making a chart for each time I save your ass. And when I do it ten times, you buy me lunch.
Kay lets out a long, weary sigh. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you settle for a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay reaches behind the counter for a couple of beers. Jay on his phone. JAY (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need a cleanup on the corner of Canal and Mott. And bring a net. Biggest one you've got. Follow Jay's gaze -- the giant fish flops its way down Ca Jay and Kay back in their booth, Jay grabs a couple noodl off another table and starts eating. Through the scene, various MiB clean-up crew people work crime scene. JAY (CONT'D) (MOUTH FULL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you eating? (GETS NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the hell was that guy? Kay's quiet. Ominously quiet. Weighing his words: KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yaz. Put him away a long time ago. Biggest mistake I ever made. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Was he the wrong guy? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Should've killed him. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, don't worry, I think I took care of him. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was too easy. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make it look easy. That's the problem with being my partner. (MORE)
JAY (CONTD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get used to my game. It's what Dr. Phil would call taking for granted. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it, hoss. This guy is different. Worse than anyone. He tried to blow up the Earth but I stopped him. He developed a dislike for me and for certain behaviors of mine, such as being alive. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you know better {than anyone. What does an MiB agent call it when 12 alien species try to kill him? Tuesday. Jay laughs at his own joke. Kay just stares. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. (calling off to cleanup GUYS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you get all of him, I mean it! He's an assembler! CLEANUP GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, Agent Kay. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, man, those noodles'll kill you before he does. I got your back. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do. Stares at his noodles a while, like there's answers in th KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to play a game with my daddy. What would you want for your last meal. Could do worse than this. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? I used to play a game with my dad, too. Called catch. I'd throw the ball, and then it'd hit the house `cause he WASN'T THERE.
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, don't badmouth your old man. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to badmouth someone you don't know. (CHECKS HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, forget it. The past is the past. And right now we have something much more important to talk about. Bowling Night. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired? What -- you afraid I'm gonna take that MVP trophy away from you? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrified. See you later. Kay takes a few tired steps and turns back -- KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And slick? Watch yourself. A guy like Yaz can come after you when you least expect it. Anywhere, anytime. Jay watches Kay walk away. Looks like he's carrying a hea load. Turns his attention to the clean up crew: KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of clean up everything don't you understand? There's a spleen on that car! CLEANUP GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On it, sir. DARK ALLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glow of a cigarette illuminates the face of... Devil Gi She reaches down. We see -- a finger with the distinctive Skull, inching its way along the road. DEVIL GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, baby? Momma's got you. now.

dialogues.speaker: MIB HQ
dialogues.text: Jay at his desk -- papers and folders everywhere -- SEARC FOR SOMETHING. We see what he's looking through -- KAY'S OLD CASE FILES. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yaz... Yaz... Yaz... Where are you, Yaz...? And he FINDS IT! JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go... Jay opens the YAZ INCIDENT REPORT INSIDE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Pictures of Yaz - A type-written report telling us YAZ APPREHENDED BY AGE

dialogues.speaker: KAY... JULY 16, 1969
dialogues.text: - Farther down on the page, a CASUALTY REPORT: ONE CASUALTY... HUMAN DEAD AT THE SCENE...

dialogues.speaker: ZED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ready to bring the pain? Reveal Zed in his ridiculous bowling outfit.

dialogues.speaker: BOWLING ALLEY
dialogues.text: A sign says: CLOSED FOR LEAGUE NIGHT We follow a couple normal-looking BOWLERS into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safely inside, the Bowlers remove their heads -- which be their bowling balls. It's the LEAGUE CHAMPIONSHIP GAME -- ALIENS VS. MIB AGENT MiB agents and aliens say hi, exchange trash-talk. We see shots of games in progress: An alien rolls a ball -- when it gets to the end of the l it sticks out arms, taking down all the pins.

The aliens cheer, slap tentacles, clink beers and swallow them whole. A many-armed alien re-sets the pins. A giant alien with perfect dainty form approaches the fou line... and -- gutter ball! He gets mad and shoots the pi with his laser-eyes. We end up with JAY AND THE MIB TEAM, NOT BOWLING BECAUSE

dialogues.speaker: THEY'RE WAITING FOR KAY --
dialogues.text: Zed paces, wearing way too much bowling regalia. ZED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Kay? We either roll or forfeit -- and I didn't put this on to forfeit! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Bowling Robot, do what we built you for. Reveal an incredibly high-tech robot wearing one of those white trash T-shirts that reads "10 reasons why Bowling i better than Women." ROBOT (ROBOT VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my time to shine. Robot fires a ball directly down into the floor. An awkwa beat as we hear the ball puncture four floors. Then a car alarm. ROBOT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes my perfect game. (ROBOT LAUGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's on me. Jay rolls -- perfect spin -- Jay watches, willing it towa the pins -- which SCRAMBLE OUT OF THE WAY! But Jay's roll too good -- it spins from fleeing pin to fleeing pin -- a

dialogues.speaker: STRIKE
dialogues.text: Jay and his teammates triumphant! The frame of a lifetime Jay looks around -- JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- the one time Kay isn't here...

dialogues.speaker: MIB HQ
dialogues.text: Jay enters -- looks a little worse for wear, like somebod who did some celebrating last night. We see why -- when he hoists his GIANT, RIDICULOUS MIB BOWLING TROPHY. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out-- The trophy raises a triumphant fist -- we realize it is i fact AN ALIEN. TROPHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're number one! In your face! Suck it! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's league MVP. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big surprise, you win every year. That's weird... JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... huh?

dialogues.speaker: MIB HQ
dialogues.text: Jay, in a good mood, flaunts his trophy to everyone in th office. The trophy continues its stream of obnoxious tras talk. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Kay? I think you want to see this. It's the bowling MVP trophy with MY name on it. Jay works his way to his desk. Kay's already at his own adjacent desk -- bent over his w his back to Jay. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you want to think twice next time you ditch me. Kay, absorbed in work, doesn't answer. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay?

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (back still to camera) Yeah? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just wanted to show you this so I could say-- (SEEING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are YOU??? Reveal -- CLINT EASTWOOD I'm agent Kay. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You new around here? " KAY" (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, partner. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, but I need the other Kay. You know, craggy old white guy... well, DIFFERENT craggy old white guy. I got you something. He hands over a "World's Best Partner" mug -- "KAY" (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I told you today how much I appreciate working together? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the HELL is going on here? Why are you pretending to be Kay? " KAY FR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem upset. Let's go get some coffee and talk about our feelings. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about instead, you go find me THIS guy? Jay opens the YAZ file and pulls out a picture of KAY. Bu now, splashed across Kay's photo, the words:
Jay stares at the photo --- in it, we notice Kay is NOW

dialogues.speaker: WEARING A STRANGE MEDALLION
dialogues.text: JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killed? In 1969? Jay grabs the YAZ FILE -- the one he looked through last night -- but now everything is different. We see -- the incident report stating ONE CASUALTY - AGEN KAY, DEAD AT SCENE... Jay can't believe it, he keeps reading... Snatches of the typewritten incident report The casualty report ONE CASUALTY... AGENT KAY, DEAD AT SCENE... A photo of Kay WEARING A STRANGE MEDALLION. Jay stares, struck by this -- JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay's dead? How? Why? The Men in Black Computer/Big Board sounds the alarm!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Attention. Inbound missiles entering solar system! Inbound missiles entering solar system! Zed enters, chuckling at the warning: ZED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, must be a Tuesday. Okay, computer [twins]. Give me a trajectory and an ETA on those puppies.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Running impact simulator... Everyone watches as we see an animated simulation: the missiles smash into EARTH...

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Catastrophic Earth impact imminent.
ZED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Welp, looks like we're all done for. Sorry, kid, it's been a good ride.

dialogues.speaker: A GENERAL FREAK-OUT ENSUES
dialogues.text: Jay remains calm: JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what's everyone freaking out about? We had one of these last week. "Kay" hides under a desk, weeping. "KAY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all gonna die! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - what is everyone's problem? What about that pan-galactic missile shield thing? ZED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, great idea, if we had one.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now running pan-galactic shield simulation. We see the missiles being shot down.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Conclusion: 6.72 billion lives saved. With shield... (shows Earth saved) without shield... (shows Earth destroyed) Sorry to say I told you so. ZED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to build one years ago, but Kay talked me out of it. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay talked you out of it? Kay wouldn't do that. He's the most distrustful person in the galaxy. He personally set up that system to defend our planet from the scum of the universe.
" KAYГ‚ВЂВЋ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we didn't have any enemies anymore. A stranger's just a friend you haven't met. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's working out great. Look, I don't know what's frying everyone's brains, but I remember the missile shield --- Kay -- the real Kay -- loved that thing. He wouldn't shut up about it. I mean, that thing was all Kay. (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Kay's dead. He's been dead for years. But I knew him yesterday. Jay looks at the YAZ file. Gears turning. He grabs a picture of Yaz -- JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did he.get an iPhone in 1969?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeking out of Yaz's jacket -- an iPhone. Something clicks -- JAY (CONT'D) (REMEMBERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay said Yaz can get you anywhere, anytime. Any TIME. So Yaz killed Kay in 1969 and now there's no missile shield. Jay realizes something and RUNS OFF OKAY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jay! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're definitely not Kay!

dialogues.speaker: JAY RUNS THROUGH MIB
dialogues.text: He runs by people dealing with the world coming to an end

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nine minutes to impact. I always loved you, microwave...
On the microwave -- it beeps plaintively. Jay runs off with purpose...

dialogues.speaker: STREETS OF NYC
dialogues.text: July in the city. A perfect summer day. Kids eat ice crea Old ladies head to matinees. The streets of New York team with humanity, blissfully unaware that they are about to In other words, a Tuesday. Jay runs through Time Square, where guys sell stuff on blankets. Desperately looking for someone... Among the sellers, a suspicious-looking guy wearing a str mixture of anachronistic clothing -- tri-cornered hat. As soon as he sees Jay, his eyes go wide and HE FLEES. Jay grabs something off the blanket and smacks him -- lay him out. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going in such a hurry, Obadiah? The past? OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? He throws his arms up, revealing a pocket watch and a telescope. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've been time-travelling. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. I've just been here, totally legit, here in New Amsterdam. I mean -- Manahatta ... n I'm legit. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What's this? Reveal the thing he just hit him with -- a ship's bell wi S.S. TITANIC on it. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, I'm out of that. That's my grandmother's.
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else you got here? OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, nothing man. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Off a Dodo in a cage. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a dodo bird? OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family pet. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he'd be happier free. Jay frees the bird -- it runs, squawking... OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, man! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. Jay picks up Spider-Man 8 off the blanket. Featuring chubby, bald 50-year-old Tobey Maguire. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pirated, man. That ain't nothing. Jay rips open his jacket -- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this? Reveal a copy of the Declaration of Independence.. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, maybe I've been time travelling a little -- just for personal use, man, just enough to GET BY-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- I'll look the other way if you tell me who's selling time travel these days. I just want your supplier.
OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. You don't mess with that guy. He'll kill you, me, and then he'll go after our families! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he won't have time. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Jay forces the guy to look up-- we see the missiles. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those hit the sun in 8 minutes. You want to live out those minutes? Or you want me to take you out of your misery? Jay picks up an ancient weapon -- crossbow, blunderbuss - off the blanket and puts it to the criminal's head. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, but don't say I didn't warn you, man. You just signed your own death warrant. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want a name. OBADIAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, but it's the last one you'll ever hear. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE MOST NON-THREATENING FACE EVER
dialogues.text: Think Michael Cera at his most geeky. CERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Trevor! Reveal -- we are in APPLE STORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Trevor is an "Apple Genius" TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment?
JAY NO--- TREVOR (CHIPPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you don't have an appointment, you'll have to come back tomorrow. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, the thing about tomorrow is, we'll all be busy being dead. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, or the world is gonna end. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone thinks their computer problem is the world coming to an end. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Take a look at this. Jay directs Cera's sightline to the sky-- TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! What is THAT? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, is We're all dead in... Seven MINUTES UNLESS--- TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless WHAT?? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start sharing the illegal time travel tech you've been slinging. NERD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can you tell me which one of these batteries is better? The 10-hour or the 12-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only need seven minutes, get the cheap one. He grabs Trevor-
JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'll show you. But this is incredibly powerful technology, so it must remain absolutely secret. Follow me. Trevor LEAVES HIS POST --- Jay follows: TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely secret, do you understand? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but we're running out of time--

dialogues.speaker: AFFLUENT WESTSIDE MOM
dialogues.text: Hey! Excuse me! TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you in a second, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: AFFLUENT WESTSIDE MOM
dialogues.text: It'll only take a minute. You see, my nanny's phone number got erased from my favorites and I have to ask her what my daughter wants for her birthday. Jay takes the phone. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see the problem. He CHUCKS THE PHONE across the store, where it SMASHES TO PIECES. She leaves in a huff. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to do that. okay, so here's what you do... Trevor pulls Jay in, ready to lay this top secret informa on him... TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so go to the clock app. And shake it. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Jay does it.
On the phone -- TIME TRAVEL BETA TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you just type in the year you want to travel to... On the phone -- it's "augmented reality" -- the image thr the phone is the image of the targeted time period. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen. This is highly crucial: Time travel is nothing to mess with. You can't change anything, you can't use new technology or all of space-time can just -- kablooey! JAY (OFF MISSILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, is it ok if I change

dialogues.speaker: THAT
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. Yeah, that's cool. Jay is about to "enter" time travel... TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- hold on a second. If you go -- I'm just gonna stay... and be dead? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll fix it. You'll only be dead for a little while. Jay DISSOLVES INTO A TIME TRAVEL EFFECT... Cera is left alone. The missiles get EVER CLOSER... Trevor opens a "Voice Recorder" app: TREVOR (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's last words. Dear posterity... Should anyone find this, let history remember that Trevor was a man of noble bearing, quiet dignity -- (IMPACT!) OH FUUUUUU-----
And the world is vapor. EVERYTHING GOES WHITE... WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure white. Jay comes to, groggy, like he has the worst hangover of a time, brain bigger than his skull, trying to make his eye focus. Trying to make sense of his strange blinding white environment -- Is this the afterlife? The reverie disrupted by a TOILET FLUSH The white resolves into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay realizes he's in a men's room, sitting in a urinal. T music transitions: Whatever hip-hop featuring a 60s sampl was playing in the Apple store -- now continues as the 60 song itself, played over a tinny portable radio. He hops up just as a young white office worker comes out one of the stalls, washes his hands... and flips Jay a quarter. Jay stares at it a beat, confused. Misreading his confusi the office worker awkwardly digs out another quarter. OFFICE WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck, you're doing a great job. The kid leaves. Jay ventures out of the bathroom and finds himself in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White guys on IBM Selectric typewriters as far as the eye see -- like the office in the Apartment. Jay stops in his tracks, taking in the 1969-ness of it al An officious guy, annoyed, runs up--
OFFICIOUS GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late! Where's Mr. Watkins' lunch? JAY OH-- OFFICIOUS GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did his girl not put in the order? The officious guy glares at the "girl" -- in her 60s.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIOUS GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shoves a bill in Jay's HAND)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run down to Woolworth's -- Two hamburger sandwiches, fries, egg cream, and a pack of luckies. If you're back in half an hour, you can keep the change. Jay looks at the SINGLE DOLLAR BILL.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIOUS GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the double, OK? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jay's moves to the elevator, waits for it. Pockets the profits of the racist misunderstandings. Elevator opens, the elevator operator opens the door -- J climbs in with a car full of older executives. Jay shakes his head, just taking this all in. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. 1969. You're all dead now. Just as the elevator's about to close, a leggy blonde tos him a set of keys. BLONDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Big Man wants his caddy. Chop- chop. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay's got the keys. He looks at the parking tag, walks do a row of beautiful classic cars, looking for the right ca stops and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG MAN'S CADDY
dialogues.text: Reveal Jay cruising in the most gorgeous 1964 Coupe deVil convertible. Fins, chrome, a thing of beauty. From the seat next to him -- a fedora. He puts it on, completing the look. In the background we notice the Leggy Blond getting yelle by the guy who must be "The Big Man" Jay HONKS and waves thank you! Jay finds some classic 60s music and enjoys himself for a minute -- a sweet ride through 60s New York. A GREAT 1969 HIT -- THE TEMPTATIONS' "Can't Get Next to Y comes on the radio. Jay is swept up in the music and soon SINGING ALONG AT FULL BLAST. At a light, he pulls even with an older Brooklyn Italian couple. They give him a disapproving look. The woman clutches her pearls just a little more protectively. He smiles and leans towards them. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what? Black president! He laughs and drives off. Pulls up at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret entrance to MiB HQ, familiar from the first mo Jay strides up to the entrance and... can't open the door Bangs on the door -- nothing. Shaking the knob, calling t the guard... nothing. From behind him:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Help you? Look a little lost. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks, listen--
Jay turns and is face-to-face with two grinning Staten Is cops. He instantly realizes what's about to go down. JAY (CONT'D) (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, guess I knew this wasn't gonna be just people handing me money and Cadillacs. COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, officer. I'll be on my way. COP 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an awful nice car. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of work you do, individual of your particular... ethnic persuasion... to buy a car like that? COP 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be anything illegal, would it? COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You an athlete or something? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm the North American champion of kiss my ass. The cop loses his smile, turns to his partner: COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sound like resisting arrest to you? COP 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure did. They grab him, start to frisk him -- COP 2 (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well. Boy, you're gonna have a little problem explaining THIS.
The cop holds up Jay's HIGH-TECH GUN -- the NOISY CRICKET and his NEURALIZER. A BLACK CROWN VIC SCREECHES UP between the cops and JAY. Out steps KAY -- but 40+ years younger. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashes a badge) I'll take it from here. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Kay, Division 2, special... (gives Jay a look) .black ops. Thank you for your cooperation, if I could ask you to look here for a moment -- Kay pulls out what looks like a NEURALIZER -- and swiftly beats each one over the head -- it's just a BLACKJACK -- crumple. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay? Kay, is that you? Oh, man it's good to see you, buddy! Jay hugs Kay -- who remains stony-faced. Jay gets a littl choked up to see his friend alive -- Kay is a rock. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you, all... sort-of- young... Kay! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's got to be the first time an unregistered alien caught sneaking onto Earth was happy to see me. Jay pulls away, realizing-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! You think -- aw,that's funny. No, it's not like that. You see, I'm your partner. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a partner I'd know it. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a simple explanation for that.
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all ears. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see I'm your partner... (knows he's about to sound CRAZY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the future. And I came back to save you. A longdry stare. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you very much. JAY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no problem, man. I got you-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thought I'd heard them all. Usually, they offer a great gift to the people of Earth in exchange for refuge. Time-travelling partner from the future -- that's some extra-credit right there, and I do appreciate you bringing some much- needed variety to what can be a very dull job. But I'm still gonna have to bring you in. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, ok, I know it sounds a little- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds a LOT-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm going to prove it to you... Because if I weren't from the future, would I know about -- your little top-secret headquarters right HERE?? He tries to force the door open. Nothing. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said -- HERE? (tries - nothing)

dialogues.speaker: HERE
dialogues.text: Jay finally kicks the door open -- And inside... we SEE...
An abandoned building, filled with spiders, etc. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Not here yet. But it will be. Gonna need to get rid of the raccoons and bats and stuff, but... it'll be real nice. Game room over there for your pinball, you love your pinball. Lotta good times there -- I'm going for an extra ball, Jay! you'd say. And I'd be there. With you. Partners. Long stare from Kay. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. And word of advice -= I don't know what it's like on your planet, but around here, a guy with your... complexion in a car like that is gonna get some attention he doesn't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the way-too-loud death-rattle exhaust note of wha sounds like ten Harleys at once. Reveal -- Yaz, the nightmare biker, looking like Dennis Hopper meets Satan, riding a badass custom skull-themed r that might have dropped out of the brain of Stanley Mouse His skull ring gleams on his pinkie. Devil Girl sits behi him, hands on his shoulders. We ride with them a beat, tearing down the highway... They STOP AT A LIGHT -- even with a brightly-painted micr full of hippies. One of the hippies leans out -- HIPPIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys like to party? Care to make a trade for the mama? Yaz pulls out his alien "guns." The stoned hippie smiles serenely and puts a flower in one of the mouths. Makes a peace sign. HIPPIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make love, not war.

Yaz "fires" the alien -- it launches into the microbus -- followed by its brother. The microbus rocks, hippies scream, the bus dents from th inside-out. On a bumper sticker: If This Van's a-rockin', don't come a knockin'. The guns, finished, return to Yaz. Yaz surveys the carnage, picks up a medallion off one of hippies. But looking at it more closely, frowns and throw it away. The head back on their way... Blood drips over the Ass, G or Grass bumper sticker... We dissolve from the blood to a deep red STRAWBERRY SUNDA Widen to reveal we are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great NYC automat... The kind of place you go when you like to be alone. Loners and weirdos populate the tables, minding their own business. Immigrants read foreign papers. Jay follows Kay as they walk by the glorious deco machine offering pies... pastries.., beverages... JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your favorite place? Makes. sense. Zero human interaction. Kay ignores him. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how old are you? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-six. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Wow, you got some city miles on you. Jay laughs. Kay ignores him, stops in front of a machine offering "SPECIALS". Jay grabs a paper off a nearby table: We see headlines ab Nixon, Vietnam, the Apollo Launch.
Jay looks at the date: July 14, 1969. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourteenth. Then we have two days. Kay really takes his time, picking out the right sandwich JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I know your lunch is important, but like I said, we only have two days here. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go... Kay puts some money in the machine -- is about to make hi selection. Jay reacts to it -- GROSS! We see -- the most unappealing ham sandwich ever. The mea is tinged with green and beginning to get a little fuzzy. one in their right mind would buy this sandwich. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. I am not letting you eat that. I didn't come all the way here to have you die before I can tell you-- Kay reaches for the button. Jay slaps his hand away. A BEAT of undignified hand-slap-fighting-- JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man. No way the world ends because you had to eat that thing-- Kay SUCCEEDS IN HITTING THE BUTTON and FWOOOOOOPI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRET DOOR instantly spins them around and Jay and Kay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud of smoke... It clears and reveals Mid-century futurism with a martini lunch office vibe. It how Isaac Asimov and Ray Bradbury would have imagined the offices.

The cloud of smoke comes from everyone smoking. Aliens ru around with ashtrays, cocktail shakers and cigarettes. Th alien smokers smoke from surprising orifices. The !liB agents have the feel of ivy league privilege. Ve male and very white. Women are there to be secretaries an eye candy. Two many-armed aliens stock the automat. Kay tosses one t sandwich, it goes right back into the automat. Jay recognizes the aliens -- it's the twins! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! [long alien name] and Bob! Don't worry, you guys get a big promotion in, like, 20 years. Kay takes Jay down an escalator. Quick atmospheric establishing shots of MiB '69: - A wall of Black and White TVs monitoring the aliens of times: Castro... Yoko... Hendrix... - A cluster of agents use a joystick to manipulate a very high-tech camera. Reveal they're using it to watch a secretary's ass. She gets wise, turns -- they raise their martinis and she giggles at them: You're incorrigible! - Aliens work switchboards, work in the steno pool. - Someone barks at an alien to grab a couple Mooners and clean something up. - An MiB barbershop quartet practices. MIB QUARTET (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men in blaaaaaaack... Jay can't help laughing -- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What planet are they from? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hamptons. Let's go somewhere we can talk. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical interrogation room table in the middle. Kay pulls out a giant form -- it looks like 10 tax return stacked together. He fits sheets of carbon between the pages. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're gonna do the forms now. Listen, Kay, I know you're gonna do what you're gonna do, but we're burning time here. When I got here, you had 48 hours. Now you've got 46. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name, planet of origin and Galactic ID NUMBER-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Agent Jay, you gave it to me. KAY (WRITING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Subject uncooperative." Purpose of visit? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save the Earth. Kay looks at the form, there's a number of options to che "Create a new race... Steal Earth women... Offer life of eternal youth... vacation... Save the Earth." He checks t box. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the Earth... Congratulations, you're the third one today... Maybe you'll get a balloon. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, don't believe me. But just listen to what I have to say, because it's going to save your life and the life of everyone in this galaxy. It hangs in the air... KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you currently pregnant or preparing to spawn?
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a killer out there. Goes by "Yaz." He's coming for you. You told me your one regret was not killing him when you had the chance. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of any Yaz. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. Here's what to look for. Long hair, leather, looks kind of like a biker. You'll know him from the skull ring on his pinky. He's trying to blow up the Earth and you get in his way somehow so he kills you. This Friday. In Florida. So, if you want to live -- do not go to Florida. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florida? I hate Florida. I hate everything South of Virginia. If that's what you came to tell me, you're wasting your time. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you're as stubborn as you always were. I mean -- always will be. Look, It's not just about you. Because he kills you, you don't live long enough to build the defense shield. And without a defense shield, the Earth gets destroyed. You get it? He kills you, the Earth gets destroyed. I have to save you from him so we can save the planet. Kay stops writing. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Well. This is finally starting to make sense. Jay looks hopeful. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're crazy. Paranoia. Delusions of self-importance--
BOOMING VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Kay! Door BANGS OPEN -- in walks THE BOSS MAN... and it sure isn't ZED. AGENT EX, flanked by junior agent underlings. EX is a wel tanned WASPy jackass with a room-temperature IQ who proba got this job from his daddy's country club connections. H good at tennis and not thrilled about this whole "civil rights" fad. Kay stands. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, chief. EX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you got a mooner in here. Don't take all day. We're not here to babysit them, just figure out where he's from and send him back. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, still trying to sort it out. He says he's human. EX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, we have the technology here to test for that. Ex steps up close to Jay. Looks him over. Then SWIFTLY PUNCHES HIM IN THE STOMACH. EX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gag reflex. Coughing. Eyes watering. Human. Code 43 him. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it, chief. THROUGH MIB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay walks Jay. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's code 43? They pass through a set of double doors. Tilt up to revea ROOM 43

dialogues.speaker: ON JAY AND KAY
dialogues.text: Jay reacts to whatever he's looking at. JAY WHAT THE-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little baby here is called a Neuralizer. REVEAL -- The 1969 Neuralizer fills an entire room. And w ARE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's manned by 60s labcoat technicians with sliderules an punchcards. The Neuralizer itself is a piece of 60s-tech-glory -- magnets, tubes, things that look like they belong in Dr. Frankenstein's lab. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, what? You're gonna neuralize ME? You can't neuralize me. Haven't you been listening? Two ALIEN ORDERLIES grab Jay. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a lay down, stretch. The orderlies force Jay on a sort of gurney -- in the '69 Neuralizer, the "patient" is fed through the machine, lik for an MRI. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You erase what's in here, you erase the whole world. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. When it's over, you'll forget all about this Yaz and Florida and the end of the world. I think it'll be good for you. Calm you down. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to calm down.
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's safe. We even tested it on one of our own men. Kay indicates Q, who wanders around like he's been lobotomized. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Agent Q! Q waves back: Q

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, agent Q! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, YOU'RE -- forget it. (back to Jay) We're still.., fine-tuning it. okay, strap him down. TWO BIG-ASS ALIEN ORDERLIES force Jay down. A TECH flips the machine ON -- TUBES POWER UP WITH HUGE N AND FANFARE. Jay struggles as he gets closer and closer to the machine Jay manages to slide his key fob out of his'pocket -- use the edge to flip open the clamp on the straps -- and HE'S FREE TECH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell-- Kay smiles -- Not bad, kid. The orderlies rush him -- Jay knocks them out. The scientists are fraidy-cats -- they hide. It's down to Jay and Kay. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice moves. You'd make a good agent. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I AM a good agent! Kay takes a SWING at Jay -- Jay dodges it easily. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, you always lead with your left.
Kay pulls his weapon -- Jay ducks behind the Neuralizer - now Kay can't shoot. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just making it worse for yourself. The following plays over a game of CAT AND MOUSE around t giant structure of the Neuralizer -- like through the sta in a library. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nowhere to run, slim. It's just if we're gonna do it easy or do it hard. Jay runs into a dead end. Kay and the orderlies are on him. The pissed-off orderlie grab him roughly, force him onto the gurney. Jay keeps flailing. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you, Kay, I can prove it... (SEARCHES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love to bowl! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowling is enjoyed by more than 95 million people in more than 90 countries. You gotta do better than that. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a scar on the back of your right hand! Jay grabs Kay's hand. They LOCK EYES for a moment. Kay le Jay flip his hand over, big build-up, REVEALING... .no scar. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. You will! I swear! Kay signals -- the Neuralizer powers up. And Jay is on the conveyor belt into the machine. This is all about to be over. Jay thinks desperately for a way ou THEN-- Eureka!! JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay! KAY!!! What about your girl on Martha's Vineyard?
Kay looks up. Jay sees an opening: JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chose the job over her -- but you never stopped thinking about her. You can't forget her. Kay grabs him. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know that? I've never told anyone that. A long look at this guy, who somehow knows things he shouldn't. And he hits the POWER OFF BUTTON... But this being TUBE TECHNOLOGY -- we stay with JAY'S TERRIFYING POV -- as he slides through the claustrophobic Neuralizer chamber -- the tubes powering down just in tim inches away from him. Jay crawls out of the Neuralizer, shaken. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Kay? It's me-- But Kay grabs him and puts a gun on him-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're gonna drag her into this, you'd better be able to back up your story. Because if you're jerking me around, I'll make a window out of your head. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, um -- according to the file, he should have entered Earth- space in the last couple days. Did you spot any unauthorized landings in the last 48 hours? Kay looks to a tech, who looks at a clipboard -- TECH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did have something -- a landing in New Jersey. Kay and Jay look at each other.
KAY (TO JAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you're coming with me. Jay grabs his key chain. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask how you're planning on getting me out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay leads a "LOBOTOMIZED" Jay through HQ. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, boys. Just did a code 43 on this one. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, fellas? Look, I put on my pants. He feels one of the agent's faces. Kay leads him to the exit. He talks to Jay as if Jay is a dim 3rd-grader who speaks little English: KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a tourist from Kansas. A city slicker took your wallet at the bus station... Kay leads Jay to a SET OF DOORS MARKED "EXIT to STREET" - MANNED BY MIB AGENTS. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two out. The agents nod to Kay and WAVE HIM THROUGH-THE EXIT... Which deposits them in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peepshow megaplex from the bad old days of time squar A creepy pervert sits in a booth. Puts money into the machine. The wall SLIDES UP -- and to his surprise, instead of a peepshow...
Jay and Kay climb out. Off the creep's reaction: JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww. Did I spoil the mood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the New Jersey State Parkway -- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better not be wasting my time- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Window out of my head. But hey -- if I don't save you, I'm dead anyway. So do what you want to me -- just make sure you watch out for yourself. They pull up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squat shack on the edge of a dump, home office to a "legitimate local business." The windows are bloodied and broken from the inside. Corpses of wiseguys litter the front of the building, all showing disturbing spore growth. [please see http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XuKjBIBBALS for reference] The corpses DEMATERIALIZE and disappear. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't look like a mob hit. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a hell of an observation. What gave it away? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spores. Dematerializing corpses. And THAT. Jay points beyond the building... a SHEER DROP Which is the edge of a HUGE SMOKING CRATER -- And how did this crater get here?
In the center, a GIANT ROCKET, all chrome and Flash Gordo It formed the crater on landing. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in. Kay draws his weapon. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna give me a.gun? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. He pulls out a Smith and Wesson, dumps the bullets, and h it over. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to get in my way. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try not to get in MY way. Jay and Kay move towards the building... BAM! BAM! BAM!! Someone's firing at them -- they dive for cover. More GUNSHOTS -- Jay gives Kay THE SIGNAL, WE SAW IN THE CHINESE RESTAURAN KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay behind me. You need to stay alive. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I will. Jay tries to go in -- Kay pushes him out of the way and g in first. VINCENZI BROTHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay bust in -- almost fall into the room because they're squabbling over who's first -- Then - BAM!
Someone's hiding under a desk, holding a gun over his hea firing randomly. Kay gets GRAZED -- They dive for cover. Kay's right hand is bleeding. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. So that's how you got the scar. Jay tosses his EMPTY GUN into the corner -- the guy under desk fires FIVE TIMES - EMPTYING HIS GUN! Jay sprints at him, flips the table -- it's a terrified, quivering WISEGUY. Jay grabs him and DISARMS HIM. The guy is FREAKED OUT. WISEGUY [TERRIFIED BLUBBERING] JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he look like? WISEGUY [BLUBBERING] JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it together! Jay SLAPS THE GUY. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who did this --- what'd he look like? WISEGUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looked like a biker... And he had a... He had a skull ring... Jay and Kay share a look. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH JAY AND KAY
dialogues.text: Walking up to Kay's car. In the background, MiB puts up a facade around the rocket "Rocket Waste Disposal", techs take samples.
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the witness? We don't have time to take him back to HQ to NEURALIZE HIM-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got something new. Portable Neuralizer. With a rumbling and BLASTS OF AIRHORNS, 18-wheelers drive housing the "portable" Neuralizer. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe how small these things are getting? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, slick. I'm making a decision to believe you. Not because I do, but because I have to, you get me? He walks to the trunk, pops it open. He flips a switch, revealing a HIDDEN ARSENAL. He grabs a COOL GUN and gives it to Jay. Jay admires the DEADLY FIREARM. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, this means you like me, doesn't it? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go get this sunovabitch. They climb in but -- SCREECH!!! A Crown Vic swerves to a stop in front of them. Out pops

dialogues.speaker: APOPLECTIC EX --
dialogues.text: EX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay! Don't move a goddamn muscle! I have you on 12 protocol violations! Kay looks to Jay. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it thirteen. He GUNS IT -- THEY TEAR OFF...
YAZ'S BIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widen - he's on his bike, pulling into

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK CITY
dialogues.text: Yaz approaches the tollbooth, manned by a gruff NY no-BS, time for anyone TOLLBOOTH COLLECTOR. TOLLBOOTH COLLECTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exact change only. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help a stranger, please? TOLLBOOTH COLLECTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. That's what I'm here for. You see that thing behind you? That's New Jersey. Go home and get some change. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been a great injustice in the Universe. I must make it right. TOLLBOOTH COLLECTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's also a great injustice? Sitting in this box all day listening to people try to get out of paying the toll. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ease your pain. On Yaz's evil grin...

dialogues.speaker: KAY AND JAY DRIVE INTO THE CITY
dialogues.text: KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell me everything you know about this Yaz scumbag. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In two days he's gonna kill you in Florida. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days. Doesn't give me a lot of time. You couldn't have come back a week ago?
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was distracted by the Earth blowing up. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have two days to kill him before he kills me. Alright, there's one cesspool everyone washes up in sooner or later. Someone'll know something there. Come on. Let's take a drive to Alien Town. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alien Town? They drive under a sign indicating: EAST VILLAGE WITH YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruising through NY. Devil Girl on the seat behind him. H pulls even with a patrol car. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, officers of the law. Like you, I care a great deal. about justice and I'm looking for some people. Maybe you can help me. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- get a shave and a haircut.. They laugh. Yaz smiles sadly. YAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever lost someone close to you? I have. I've lost everyone. Everyone except them. Can you help me find them? He gives the cops a picture, they take it grudgingly -- w see it: a half dozen hippies wearing medallions. The cops look at each other and raise eyebrows. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one part of town where people like that hang out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The historic Village landmark. Jay and Kay approach... 60s freaks eyeball the squares...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay ride to the sixth floor. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gotta be something that connects you to Yaz. What cases are you working on? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'got this whole dry ice thing. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dry ice? What's that? Someone get killed over some dry ice? Smuggling something in some dry ice? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We just can't figure out what it is. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you're pretty low on the totem pole, aren't you? The great Kay, looking for dry ice. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push your luck. The doors open, and we're in...

dialogues.speaker: A WAY-OUT 60'S PARTY
dialogues.text: Kay's on the hunt for someone. They weave their way throu the far-out types, hear snippets of high-60s party conversations. Someone notices Jay's suit -- PARTY SNOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, a time traveller? JAY REACTS--

dialogues.speaker: PARTY SNOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That suit is SO five years ago. Kay sees who he's looking for, grabs him: KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Reveal ANDY WARHOL -- and this is the Factory, and this i one of Warhols' famous parties. Draped on Warhol -- a bunch of strange hangers-on, his "stars." ULTRAVIOLET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yum, pigs are getting cute. Jay smiles -- she looks skeeved out. ULTRAVIOLET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant the young one. Warhol speaks with his strange -- yes, almost alien -- affect. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not really a good time to talk. I'm creating a party. (sighs, totally put out) But... Maybe if he asks me. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What - me? WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never say no to anything that came out of that beautiful mouth... Jay is visibly uncomfortable. Kay nudges Jay - do it. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Grumbles about what he has to do for his partner]. (then, to Warhol) We need to talk. Please. Warhol and his Stars ooh and ahh over Jay. Someone snaps picture. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, just amazing. Alright, you talked me into it. Follow me. (MORE)     55 WARHOL (CONT'D) (TO ENTOURAGE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be back soon, stars.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE STUDIO LOFT
dialogues.text: From here, a window looks out over the whole scene. Warhol leads the guys in, shuts the door and LOCKS IT. Immediately, his ENTIRE AFFECT CHANGES -- he rips off his WIG, lights a cigarette, and talks like a hard-nosed cop. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, Kay, are you TRYING to blow my cover? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy agent W, your cover is perfectly safe. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly safe? Are you out of your goddamned mind? It's only a matter of time before they figure out I'm a total fraud. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool your jets-- WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so out of ideas I'm painting bananas and soup cans for chrissakes. How long do you really think they're gonna keep buying this shit? Warhol slumps on a chair. WARHOL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it anymore. Talking to these nutjobs and all these goddamn hippies. God, I hate hippies. They're just filthy, Kay. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know they are, buddy. But you're doing good work here. We need you. A knock at the door -- Warhol gets back into character --
WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there... I'm just... filming these men eating a hamburger... It's... transcendent. Okay, now the pickle... (back to cop form) You see what I mean? And who the hell's this guy? New partner? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm his old partner. I came from the future to warn him ABOUT-- WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, fine, don't tell me. Alright, what do you need? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for a recent arrival. Long hair, wears a lot of leather... Warhol indicates the party below -- half the guests match that description. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to do better than that. Look, if that's all you have, I can't help you. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you know someone who's seen something.

dialogues.speaker: STAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Andy, the horse is here... WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back in there-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up -- the guy we're looking for -- he's out to destroy the world. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, what's new? What does an MiE call it when someone tries to destroy the world? Tuesday. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you made that up.
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, W, I got a feeling on this one. Like we should take it serious. And we don't have much time. Jay checks his watch. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 hours. WARHOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, alright. (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, talk to Prell and Vidal. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PARTY
dialogues.text: ON TWO BEAUTIFUL WOMEN - in very 60s fashion with incredi giant hair - one with a big afro, one with big chignon hairdo.

dialogues.speaker: WARHOL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (back in "character") Vidal, Prell, can you please talk to these nice men? The women's LIPS DON'T MOVE -- they respond in incongruou GRUFF VOICES: PRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadaya want? VIDAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like cops to me. ain't talking. PRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not rats. We swing around them to REVEAL that Warhol/Kay/Jay are no talking to the women's faces -- They're STANDING BEHIND THE WOMEN -- TALKING TO THEIR HAI DO'S which we realize are two COMPLETE HAIR ALIENS, VIDAL PRELL, perched atop these women. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start talking, you two, before you end up on a barber's floor.
PRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you don't scare me. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Kay reaches into a passing woman's purse, pulls out HAIRSPRAY. Grab some of Prell and holds up the spray. PRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't! He sprays the hair, it starts to SCREAM IN PAIN. VIDAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, you bastard! PRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, we don't know anything! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna play tough? How about we take a ride to the barber college, see how tough you are? Kay keeps shaking them down, but Jay is distracted... On Jay... something is making him think... A sound... it. grows louder... we start to be able to mak the distinct bip... bip... bip... of PONG Jay FOLLOWS THE SOUND... To a group of people -- that incredible Factory mix from slumming socialites to Black Panthers to the freakiest freaks... They surround a SKANKY GUY -- and whatever they're watchi on TV is so mesmerizing it's like they're seeing the face God... BROOKE ASTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too beautiful. Someone takes a picture of the screen. Jay walks around the TV -- REVEAL: They're watching CLASSIC EARLY 70S PONG.

The SKANKY GUY controls it via a BIG MEDALLION hooked up the TV antennae terminals. He's playing against a young clean-cut square. Jay grabs the wires and rips them out, cutting off the ga Everyone JEERS him. ON KAY, hearing the noise, turns to see what's going on. SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, man? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wondering where you got that. SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother. The crowd laughs. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. So my mother gave you a technology that hasn't been

dialogues.speaker: INVENTED FOR SEVEN YEARS
dialogues.text: Jay grabs him by the throat. Partygoers react. Someone takes pictures. Someone claps i delight. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now how about you tell me where you really got it? The skanky guy knows he's in trouble. SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... uh... okay, no hassles, man... I got it from that dude over there... With the beard. Jay turns, lets go just long enough for the guy to LEAP O THE WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay takes off after him -- Kay joins And the CHASE IS ON

dialogues.speaker: CHASE THROUGH THE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay chase the guy through various 60s locations - commune, an ashram, a folk club, a protest.

Everywhere they are mistaken for "pigs" - people get in t way. To Jay's surprise, young Kay is a hell of a runner, in incredible shape. It gets competitive between them... Until Jay can't keep up -- Kay takes off... Kay runs the Skanky Guy down - Jay huffs and puffs his way over, grabs the medallion. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, one more time. Where'd you get this? SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a gift-- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Kay puts a gun on him. JAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. This is my partner. He's about to get fired for excessive violence and he doesn't have much left to lose. SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed it! CLICK! Kay cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: SKANKY GUY
dialogues.text: I stole it, okay? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I like. A nice, honest thief. Stole it from who? SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't even care, man. They leave their money everywhere. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who they are--
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're not worth much to us, are you? The gun comes back out. SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard they were Archanans. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archanans? They're pretty far out of their neighborhood. I didn't think we'd ever had one on Earth before. SKANKY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you where they live! Southwest corner of 3rd and Avenue C. Top floor. Apartment 12. Jay rips the medallion off his neck.

dialogues.speaker: SKANKY GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow! JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do a lot worse. Get the hell out of here. The guy runs off. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal with the necklace? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wearing one just like it when you died. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: SOUTHWEST CORNER OF 3RD AND AVENUE C
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay pull up in front of the building. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That address. It's familiar. He pulls out a notebook. KAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to come by here tomorrow to check out a lead on the dry ice case.
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you come here tomorrow, get tangled up with these Archanans... And... KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Yaz kills me? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. So do me and the people of Earth a favor and be careful. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, put on your big girl panties and let's go. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I've always got my big girl panties on. Huh. That didn't sound right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay ride up... KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing back at the party, what was it? Some kind of game? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just any game, PONG. Game of kings. But it wasn't invented until 1974. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was the only kid on my block who didn't have one. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, what's the matter? Daddy didn't buy you the toy you wanted? JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have a daddy to not buy me toys. Here's the only thing I ever got from him-- He holds up his key chain.
KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's rough. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse. You're the closest thing I have to a dad. DOORS OPEN...

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE RATTY HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay move carefully, ready for trouble. They get to the door -- Apartment 12. Jay points to the door -- THIS IS IT! They see -- THE DOOR IS SMASHED IN, PUNCHED OFF ITS HINGE And punched into the door -- THE IMPRESSION OF A SKULL RI JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's from Yaz's ring. He was here. Or is here. Jay SIGNALS KAY KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you keep doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into the room on high alert... But it's empty. They realize the strangeness of the room - alien technolo (including a TV hooked up to something strange with tons wires hanging out) and lots of money.. LOTS of money... Not just piles -- the actual furniture is MADE OF STACKS MONEY. They've been using it for scrap paper, for napkins JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Yaz was never after you... he was after the Archanans. You just got in the way. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which must make them damn important. But what does he want with them?
JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'No sign of struggle. They must've cleared out before he got here. Like they knew he was coming. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's probably on their trail now. But where the hell did they go? They look around, puzzling over this place. Jay picks up $100 bill off a table made out of stacks of money. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think this might tell us something? On the $100 bill: A strange series of words and numbers: 3 2... 5 1... 7 5. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like some kind of code. We'll take it to HQ, run it through the computer. Figure out where they went.

dialogues.speaker: BACK THROUGH THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay walk down the dark hallway -- Yaz steps out of the shadows --

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay head back to HQ. Kay drives, Jay stares at th $100 bill, squinting at it, turning it over -- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about bible verses? Coordinates? Airplane flights? Shoe sizes? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is how you do it in the future, huh? You just keep guessing until you figure it out? JAY (EUREKA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone numbers! They stop at a light.

Suddenly -- WHAM! WHAM! Someone FRANTICALLY POUNDS on the trunk -- a frightened 12-year-old prostitute wearing what basically Jodi Foster's Taxi Driver hooker costume -- hotpants, mary janes, halter top. There's something famil about her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake! Help me, would you? There's some maniac after me - JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down -- who's after you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was like nothing I ever saw -- crazy eyes, and this freaky skull ring. Jay and Kay look at each other: JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. This is a dangerous city for a girl. The light turns green -- we're on the girl's face. Jay an Kay looking straight ahead. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where can we take you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make a left up here. Kay does it... There's a rushing noise... In the back seat, Hot Pants Girl IS "INFLATING" AND BECOM

dialogues.speaker: DEVIL GIRL
dialogues.text: The car turns down a dark, deserted alley. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Seems dangerous. DEVIL GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me. Reveal -- the girl has fully "inflated" into her natural -- DEVIL GIRL! The outfit is grotesque on her.

SET PIECE FIGHT in the car. Employing cool MiB tech built into the car. Devil Girl subdued, locked into the trunk in a "CONTAINME SACK" -- like what you'd use to stuff a raccoon into. The fight's over, the guys slump against the car. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I'd bet you two to one Yaz sent her. Beat. Light bulb moment for Jay -- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that again! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Yaz sent her. JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the whole thing! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd bet you two to one Yaz sent her. On Jay, realizing-- He grabs the $100 bill -- JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where they are!

dialogues.speaker: ON JAY AND KAY
dialogues.text: Walking -- we hear sounds of crowds, of cheering, REVEAL ARE AT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
